alert.note: Alert for Badlands Area; Bennett County Area; Central Black Hills; Custer County Plains; Eastern Foot Hills; Mellette and Todd Counties; Southern Black Hills; Tripp County (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued October 22 at 2:17AM MDT until October 22 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FAR SOUTHWEST SOUTH DAKOTA... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY ACROSS MUCH OF NORTHEAST WYOMING...THE BLACK HILLS...AND THE REST OF SOUTHERN SOUTH DAKOTA... .Today will be warm and dry across much of the area as a warm front lifts slowly north across northeast Wyoming, the Black Hills, and southern South Dakota. Southwesterly winds will become quite gusty near and to the south of the boundary in the afternoon, with humidity values dropping into the teens. Combined with dry fuels, this will produce critical fire weather conditions. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 320, 321, 324, 325, 332, 333, 334, AND 335... The National Weather Service in Rapid City has issued a Red Flag Warning for gusty winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 11 AM this morning to 7 PM MDT this evening. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zones 320 Central Black Hills, 321 Southern Black Hills, 324 Eastern Foot Hills, 325 Custer County Plains, 332 Badlands Area, 333 Bennett County Area, 334 Mellette and Todd Counties and 335 Tripp County. * WINDS...Southwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 10 percent. * IMPACTS...The combination of gusty winds and low relative humidity would produce critical fire weather conditions.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Badlands Area; Bennett County Area; Central Black Hills; Custer County Plains; Eastern Foot Hills; Mellette and Todd Counties; Southern Black Hills; Tripp County
